title: CSV File Upload Success with Drag-and-Drop
description: Verify that users can successfully upload a valid CSV file using drag-and-drop interface respecting size limit.

steps.description: Navigate to the file upload page
Drag and drop a valid CSV file smaller than 10MB into the upload dropzone
Check file upload progress is displayed and updates in real-time via SSE
Confirm upload completion notification is shown
Verify uploaded file metadata is saved with UUID-based filename in backend storage
Verify backend API returns 200 status and correct success response

title: CSV File Upload Success with Click-to-Select
description: Verify successful CSV file upload via clicking to select the file, validating file format and size.

steps.description: Go to the file upload page
Click the file selection button
Select a valid CSV file under 10MB
Check upload progress visible and updated live via SSE
Confirm success message on upload completion
Validate file metadata is stored in PostgreSQL with UUID-based filename
Ensure backend upload API responds with expected HTTP status and data

title: CSV File Upload Validation - Reject Non-CSV File
description: Ensure the frontend rejects files that are not CSV and prevents upload with appropriate error messages.

steps.description: Attempt to upload a file with an unsupported format (e.g., .txt or .jpg)
Verify frontend validation blocks the upload attempt
Check that a user-friendly error message is displayed indicating unsupported format
Ensure no backend API call is made for upload

title: CSV File Upload Validation - Reject File Exceeding Size Limit
description: Verify that files larger than the 10MB limit are blocked from upload with proper notification.

steps.description: Try uploading a valid CSV file larger than 10MB
Confirm frontend prevents upload due to size restriction
Check error message indicates file size exceeds allowed maximum
Verify no backend upload API request is sent

title: File List Pagination and Search Functionality
description: Validate the paginated file list shows correct metadata and supports accurate search filtering by filename.

steps.description: Upload multiple CSV files to generate a list exceeding one page
Navigate to the file list page
Verify that files are listed with correct metadata: name, size, and upload date
Use pagination controls to navigate between pages
Ensure correct files are displayed per page and no duplicates in listings
Use the search feature to filter files by partial and full filename
Verify only files matching the search query are displayed
Check the backend file listing API responds with correct filtered and paginated data

title: File Details Modal Displays Complete Metadata and Analysis
description: Check that selecting a file shows detailed metadata, timestamps, file path, and CSV analysis report correctly in a modal.

steps.description: From the file list, select a file to open its details modal
Verify modal displays accurate file metadata including UUID filename, original name, size, and upload date/time
Confirm presence and accuracy of CSV analysis report sections: null counts, duplicate records, and overall data quality metrics
Verify data presented matches results generated by pandas analysis on backend
Close the modal and verify UI returns to file list without issues

title: CSV Analysis Report Identifies Nulls and Duplicates Accurately
description: Ensure the analysis report correctly detects null values, undefined entries, and duplicate rows in uploaded CSV files.

steps.description: Upload a CSV file crafted with known null values and duplicate rows
Open the CSV analysis report modal for the uploaded file
Verify report identifies and counts null values per column accurately
Check that duplicate record detection matches expected duplicates in the file
Validate correctness and completeness of other data quality metrics shown

title: File Deletion with Confirmation Removes File and Metadata
description: Verify that file deletion prompts user confirmation and successfully deletes file from storage and database.

steps.description: Select a file in the file list and initiate the delete action
Check that a confirmation dialog appears asking user to confirm deletion
Confirm the deletion
Verify the file metadata entry is removed from PostgreSQL
Ensure physical CSV file is deleted from backend storage
Confirm file list refreshes to exclude the deleted file
Backend deletion API returns proper success status

title: File Deletion Cancel Does Not Remove File
description: Ensure that cancelling the deletion confirmation dialog leaves the file intact in storage and database.

steps.description: Select a file for deletion
Observe confirmation dialog appears
Cancel the deletion
Verify the file still appears in the file list
Confirm backend still retains the file record and storage exists

title: Real-Time Progress Updates During Upload and Analysis via SSE
description: Test that Server-Sent Events are correctly streamed, received, and rendered as progress updates in the UI for upload and analysis processes.

steps.description: Start uploading a large valid CSV file
Observe live progress updates streamed from backend and rendered in UI
Verify progress includes upload percentage and transitions to analysis status dynamically
Confirm final completion update is displayed after analysis ends
Check SSE connection is gracefully closed on completion or error

title: Backend API Endpoints Return Expected Status Codes and Responses
description: Validate all major backend API endpoints (upload, file listing, details, deletion) respond correctly with proper HTTP status codes and data structures.

steps.description: Perform file upload API call with a valid CSV payload
Check response status is 200 and payload contains expected metadata with UUID filename
Call file listing endpoint with and without search parameters
Verify paginated response structure and data correctness
Request file details API for specific file
Validate detailed file metadata and analysis report data returned
Send file deletion request for existing file
Confirm 200 success and backend data removal
Send deletion request for nonexistent file
Check proper error status code (e.g., 404) and error message

title: Data Integrity on Upload - Ensure UUID Naming and Metadata Accuracy
description: Test data integrity by verifying uploaded files are stored with UUID-based filenames and metadata in database matches uploaded file attributes.

steps.description: Upload a CSV file
Retrieve stored file information from the backend database
Confirm physical filename is a UUID not original filename
Verify metadata fields (original filename, size, upload timestamp) are accurate and consistent
Check no filename conflicts occur on repeated uploads

title: Logging Captures Key Events and Errors
description: Ensure important operations and errors during file uploads, deletions, and analysis are logged appropriately for troubleshooting.

steps.description: Trigger file upload process
Verify logs record upload start, progress, and completion events
Attempt to upload invalid file format or oversized file
Check error logs capture validation failure details
Delete a file
Confirm logs record deletion request and success or failure

title: Frontend UI Responsiveness Across Browsers and Devices
description: Validate that the application frontend UI renders correctly and behaves consistently on modern browsers and various devices.

steps.description: Open the application on multiple modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari)
Verify UI layout is consistent and no visual glitches occur
Test on different device sizes including mobile, tablet, and desktop
Confirm responsive behavior of components, including drag-and-drop area, tables, modals, and dialogs
Ensure touch interactions work correctly on touch-enabled devices

title: Concurrent Uploads and Data Consistency
description: Test system behavior when multiple users upload CSV files concurrently ensuring no data corruption or conflict.

steps.description: Simultaneously initiate multiple CSV file uploads from different clients
Verify all files are uploaded with unique UUID filenames
Check no metadata collisions in database
Observe real-time progress updates correctly streamed independently per client

title: Handling Network Failure During Upload
description: Simulate a network interruption during file upload and verify graceful error handling and user notification.

steps.description: Start uploading a valid CSV file
Cut network connection during upload stream
Confirm that the UI shows an error state for upload failure
Ensure backend logs capture the failure event
Check that incomplete file is not saved or cleaned up properly
